Sequence Information.Source: Litoria rothii (Roth's tree frog); also Litoria splendida (Magnificent tree frog)
Sequence Information.Family: Belongs to the frog skin active peptide family (Caerin subfamily)
Sequence Information.Target Organism: [Ref.10601876]Gram-positive bacteria:Leuconostoc lactis (MIC=6 µg/ml), Listeria innocua (MIC=50 µg/ml), Micrococcus luteus (MIC=25 µg/ml), Streptococcus uberis (MIC=50 µg/ml), Staphylococcus epidermidis (MIC=100 µg/ml);Gram-negative bacterium:Pasteurella multocida (MIC=100 µg/ml).[Ref.26026377]Virus:HIV:inhibition of HIV Pseudovirus (PsV) infection in CD4+ T cells(IC50=2.5 µM).
Sequence Information.Hemolytic Activity: No hemolysis information or data found in the reference(s) presented in this entry
Sequence Information.Cytotoxicity: [Ref.26026377]CD4+ T Lymphocytes:50% cell death at 22	µM.
Sequence Information.Function: Antibacterial peptide with wide spectrum of activity.

Literature.Title: Inhibition of HIV infection by caerin 1 antimicrobial peptides.
Literature.Author: VanCompernolle S, Smith PB, Bowie JH, Tyler MJ, Unutmaz D, Rollins-Smith LA.

Literature.Title: The rothein peptides from the skin secretion of Roth's tree frog Litoria rothii. Sequence determination using positive and negative ion electrospray mass spectrometry.
Literature.Author: Brinkworth CS, Bowie JH, Bilusich D, Tyler MJ.

Literature.Title: Differences in the skin peptides of the male and female Australian tree frog Litoria splendida. The discovery of the aquatic male sex pheromone splendipherin, together with phe8 caerulein and a new antibiotic peptide caerin 1.10.
Literature.Author: Wabnitz PA, Bowie JH, Tyler MJ, Wallace JC, Smith BP.
